Whipped Ricotta Dip with Charred Jalapeño & Roasted Garlic Recipe | Bon Appetit




















































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginSPONSOREDWhipped Ricotta Dip with Charred Jalapeño & Roasted GarlicSponsored by Stacy's®FacebookPinterestTwitterEmailLight, airy folds of whipped ricotta and lemon bouy sliced jalapeños in this bright summer dip to pair with Stacy’s® Parmesan Garlic & Herb or Multigrain Pita ChipsPrintIngredients1 head garlic4 whole jalapeños16 oz. whole milk ricotta2 tablespoons heavy cream1 lemon, zested then juicedpinch of saltpinch of pepperOne bag of Stacy’s® Parmesan Garlic & Herb or Multigrain Pita ChipsRecipe PreparationPreheat the oven to 400°F. Cut the top off the garlic bulb and place on top of a piece of foil. Drizzle the garlic with olive oil and season generously with salt and pepper. Enclose the garlic head in the foil and roast for 25-30 minutes on a small sheet tray, until garlic cloves are soft and golden.Drizzle the jalapeños with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place onto a separate small foil-lined sheet pan and roast for 25-30 minutes, or until the jalapeño skin is charred and bubbly. Remove from oven and let jalapeños cool. Once jalapeños are cool enough to handle, remove the stem, skin, and seeds. Roughly chop the flesh into small pieces.Place the ricotta in a bowl and add the heavy cream. Drizzle with 2 Tbsp. of olive oil and season generously with salt and pepper. Using a rubber spatula, beat the ricotta, heavy cream and olive oil until creamy and smooth.Squeeze the garlic cloves out of their skins directly into the ricotta. Fold in the chopped jalapeños, lemon zest, and lemon juice and combine thoroughly. Taste and season again if necessary.Garnish with thinly sliced jalapeños and enjoy with Stacy’s® Parmesan Garlic & Herb or
